intro: Teucrium micranthum, commonly known as small-flowered germander, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal and culinary uses. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually violet or purple, arranged in spikes at the ends of the stems. Teucrium micranthum is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands.
